intro: Pleurophyllum gilliesianum, commonly known as the New Zealand violet, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy purple or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in damp, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Pleurophyllum gilliesianum plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is also valued for its ornamental qualities.
